required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Repair of Groin Hernias After Abdominal Prostatectomy With Robotic TAPP
clinical_study.official_title: Lichtenstein or Robotic TAPP Repair of Groin Hernias After Abdominal Prostatectomy: a Single Centre Retrospective Comparative Study

brief_summary.textblock: This retrospective study investigates if robotic assisted groin hernia repair in patients who previously underwent abdominal prostatectomy has an equal or more favorable clinical outcome, compared to open repair in those patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
In the personal practice of the investigators, there has been a decrease in open groin hernia repair from 17% to 6% since the introduction of robotic assisted surgery. This reflects a change in indication for complex hernias from an open to a minimal invasive approach. One of the typical indications for open approach before adopting the robotic platform were groin hernias after previous abdominal prostatectomy. Since prostatectomy results in scarring of the retropubic area where we need to dissect during MIS groin hernia repair, an open anterior approach is often suggested. With the enhanced view and instrument dexterity of the robotic platform, the investigators have now changed to a minimal invasive approach in these patients.
Therefore, this study will evaluate the clinical outcome after robotic assisted repair of groin hernias in patients who previously underwent an abdominal prostatectomy in comparison to open groin hernia repair.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From admission until hospital discharge, on average 12-24 hours
primary_outcome.description: Complications during hospital stay according to Clavien-Dindo
Skin-to-skin operating time and complications during the procedure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately post hospital discharge until 1 month postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: Complications at 1 month follow-up (readmission, seroma, infection) according to Clavien-Dindo

arm_group.description: Patients who underwent inguinal hernia repair via an open Liechtenstein procedure
Patients who underwent inguinal hernia repair via robotic assisted laparoscopy

intervention.description: Robotic assisted inguinal hernia repair with DaVinci Xi system instead of open repair

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent robotic assisted or open inguinal hernia repair in the period March 2015 - March 2020 and previously underwent an abdominal prostatectomy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients
- Underwent uni-or bilateral groin hernia repair in the period March 2015 - March 2020
- Groin hernia repair via robotic assisted laparoscopy or open surgery
- History of abdominal prostatectomy before the groin hernia repair
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age below 18
- Groin hernia repair via conventional laparoscopy
- Groin hernia repair via open surgery other than Liechtenstein method
- Groin hernia repair without mesh placement
